# Adrenal insufficiency
## Also known as Addison's disease
### Key points about adrenal insufficiency
  * Adrenal insufficiency occurs when your body doesn't produce enough of certain hormones. 
  * You can take medicine to replace the missing hormones and live a normal, active life.
  * Adrenal insufficiency can affect people of any age or gender.
  * It is caused by either damage to your adrenal glands (Addison's disease or primary adrenal insufficiency), or when your pituitary gland doesn't produce enough of a specific hormone (secondary adrenal insufficiency).
  * You also need to carry a corticosteroid injection with you at all times in case you have an adrenal crisis.


![Tired woman at gym](https://healthify.nz/assets/Healthy-Living/Exercise/Tired-woman-at-gym-canva-950x690.jpg)
![](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/a/adrenal-insufficiency)
####  What is adrenal insufficiency? 
Adrenal insufficiency is an endocrine, or hormonal, disorder that occurs when your adrenal glands don't produce enough of certain hormones.
